thread.title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Arsenal star Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain bound for Anfield?
thread.title_full: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Arsenal star Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain bound for Anfield?

author: Football Spy
title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Arsenal star Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain bound for Anfield?
text:
The Ox could end up at Anfield (Photo: PA) Share Get Liverpool FC   Thank you for subscribing!   
Liverpool could be in line to snap up Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain should the Arsenal star make an expected move in the summer. 
The Telegraph agree with a number of reports, including by the Mirror, that the Ox is looking for an exit after becoming frustrated with his supporting role under Arsene Wenger. 
And while Manchester United and Manchester City are said to be interested, the paper says the Reds could be his next home. 
Oxlade-Chamberlain has only 12 months left on his contract. 
"Sources close to the 23-year-old have suggested he needs a fresh challenge with Arsenal yet to offer him a new deal,” reports the paper. 
"It now appears that there is little chance that Oxlade-Chamberlain will sign a new contract even if one is offered to him because the club have left it so late and he craves more regular first-team football.” Read More Henderson and Sturridge major doubts to face Burnley 
Liverpool captain Jordan Henderson and Daniel Sturridge are both doubts for Sunday's visit of Burnley. 
The pair have both missed the last two matches, Henderson with a foot problem while Sturridge had a virus and then suffered a hip injury. 
Reports suggest that neither have returned to full training yet and were not able to rejoin their team-mates on Wednesday. Henderson looks set to miss the Burnley game on Sunday (Photo: Liverpool FC via Getty Images) Barton to face Reds after FA probe postponed 
Joey Barton's Football Association hearing into betting charges has been postponed. 
The 34-year-old Burnley midfielder was due to appear before an FA commission on Wednesday, having accepted a misconduct charge relating to 1,260 bets over a 10-year period. 
It is possible a lengthy ban could ensue - though no direct precedent exists - and the Clarets were prepared for the fact that he could have played his final match for the club with his contract up at the end of the season. Barton is available for the Liverpool clash (Photo: Mark Robinson) Brandt top of Klopp's wish list? 
Jurgen Klopp knows what he likes and he likes Julian Brandt very much. (Photo: AFP) 
The Bayer Leverkusen winger has long been a target for the Liverpool boss and according to the Liverpool Echo he will make the 20-year-old winger a priority. 
Bayern Munich and Real Madrid are also keen on the wonderkid, while James Pearce of the Echo told the Anfield Edition : "I’m not sure if he’s the No.1 target but he’s certainly very high up on Klopp’s summer shopping list." 
Brandt said this week he was keen on a move away from Germany and cited Leroy Sane and Julian Draxler as players he's like to emulate. poll loading Will Liverpool finish in the Premier League's top four this season? 5000+ VOTES SO FAR
